page.title: 03POPULATION DOWNLAND MINAL
page.content: The total population of the area is sixty, and there are twenty-six dwellings, one vacant. Ten people live in farm dwellings close together forming the NE corner of the village of Ogbourne St. George, in the valley, 205739. The remaining fifty live in the isolated farmsteads and their cottages spread over the high parts of the area. Apart from one new isolated farmhouse, 206734, the dwellings, or cluster of dwellings, lie at eight sites at approximately 1000m. intervals. Five sites are working farms, including the lands surrounding the remaining farmhouse which is now used as a weekend cottage. Not all the fifty inhabitants are employed on the farms, nor do all the farm workers live in the area.
